title: 112_hr3662
content: The Act titled "Down Payment to Protect National Security Act of 2011" aims to reduce the number of federal employees. The Act "Down Payment to Protect National Security Act of 2011" defines an agency as an executive agency under title 5, USC. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will determine the number of employees in each agency within 60 days of the Act's enactment. Each agency head must cooperate in this determination. The replacement hire rate allows for hiring one employee for every three who leave during a specified period. The Act allows for a reduction in full-time employees in agencies until a 10 percent decrease is reached, with waivers possible in cases of war or emergencies. SEC. 3. REDUCTION OF DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS TO ACHIEVE SAVINGS FROM FEDERAL EMPLOYEE PROVISIONS. Section 251(c) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to set new discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014. For fiscal year 2012, the security category is allocated $684 billion and the nonsecurity category $359 billion. For fiscal year 2013, the security category is allocated $686 billion and the nonsecurity category $361 billion. For fiscal year 2014, the discretionary category is allocated $1.051 trillion in new budget authority. In fiscal years 2015 to 2020, the discretionary category received new budget authority ranging from $1,070 billion to $1,192 billion. In fiscal year 2021, the discretionary category is allocated $1,217 billion in new budget authority. SEC. 4. REDUCTION OF REVISED DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS TO ACHIEVE SAVINGS FROM FEDERAL EMPLOYEE PROVISIONS. The discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 2013 through 2021 are revised under section 251A of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. For fiscal year 2013, the budget authority is set at $546 billion for the security category and $501 billion for the nonsecurity category. For fiscal years 2015 to 2018, budget authority for the security category ranges from $560 billion to $584 billion, and for the nonsecurity category ranges from $510 billion to $531 billion. For fiscal years 2018 to 2021, budget authority for the security category increases from $598 billion to $624 billion, and for the nonsecurity category increases from $543 billion to $568 billion. For fiscal year 2021, the budget authority is $638 billion for the security category and $579 billion for the nonsecurity category. SEC. 5. CALCULATION OF TOTAL DEFICIT REDUCTION. Amendments are made to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985, including changes to specified dollar amounts and fiscal years.
